newsitem.title: USA: Stocks fall in volatile reaction to Fed decision.
newsitem.headline: Stocks fall in volatile reaction to Fed decision.

text.p: Blue-chip stocks ended lower Tuesday as the Federal Reserve's decision to hold interest rates steady drew a classic buy-on-the-rumor and sell-on-the-news market response.
Based on early and unofficial data, the Dow Jones industrial average ended 20.71 points lower at 5,874.03 just one day after setting a record closing high of 5.894.74.
The blue-chip index was also weighed down by a sell-off in the stock of AT&T Corp., which tumbled 5-3/4 to 51-1/2 on an earnings warning.
In the broader market, advancing issues led declines 12-10 on active volume of 456 million shares on the New York Stock Exchange.
